titleStmt.title: Signal dangers and deliverances both by land and sea comprehending a short account of the siege of Vienna, one of the most memorable in this last age; together with a description of a violent tempest on the Forth / in two small poems by the same hand.
titleStmt.author: Tyler, Alexander.

titleStmt.title: Signal dangers and deliverances both by land and sea comprehending a short account of the siege of Vienna, one of the most memorable in this last age; together with a description of a violent tempest on the Forth / in two small poems by the same hand.
titleStmt.author: Tyler, Alexander.
Tyler, Alexander. Tempest between Burnt-Island and Leith in a boat.

notesStmt.note: Attributed by Wing to Alexander Tyler.
Place of pulication supplied by Wing.
"The tempest between Burnt-Island and Leith in a boat, in November, 1681" has special t.p. and separate pagination.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.

person.persName: John King of Poland, III Sobieski,
